sources.title: The River of Romance (1929) WALLACE BEERYüçï MARY BRIAN
sources.description:
It's Friday @PizzaFLIX 
Stars: Charles Buddy Rogers, Wallace Beery, Mary Brian
Director: Richard Wallace

Step into the golden age of American cinema with this rare Paramount Pictures production, directed by Richard Wallace. This early talkie brings audiences a dramatic blend of Southern tradition, personal honor, and heartfelt romance set against the backdrop of post‚ÄìCivil War Mississippi. Adapted from Booth Tarkington‚Äôs stage play Magnolia, the film stars Charles ‚ÄúBuddy‚Äù Rogers as the young protagonist torn between the codes of the Old South and his own conscience.

The distinguished cast features the incomparable WALLACE BEERY, whose commanding presence and rich characterization add depth and grit to the story. Mary Brian delivers a graceful and nuanced performance as a young Southern belle, while Henry B. Walthall and June Collyer round out a talented ensemble that captures the era‚Äôs style and emotional intensity.

Are you a PizzaFLIX Fanatic? Join our exclusive Fan Club for dedicated Classic movie lovers: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCE34fwgW7kWr7tc7YiOWtRw/join

üçï Be sure to LIKE, COMMENT, and SUBSCRIBE for more rare, vintage films every Friday on PizzaFLIX.

With its authentic period setting, moral conflicts, and themes of courage versus conformity, this motion picture offers a captivating glimpse into Hollywood‚Äôs transitional years from silent films to sound. Ideal for classic film collectors, vintage cinema enthusiasts, and fans of the legendary WALLACE BEERY.

#TheRiverOfRomance #WallaceBeery #CharlesBuddyRogers #MaryBrian #RichardWallace #ParamountPictures #ClassicHollywood #1920sCinema #OldHollywood #FilmHistory #AFICatalog #GoldenAgeOfHollywood #PizzaFLIX

metadata.Plot: Mississippi, 1830's. Tom Rumsford comes back to Magnolia Landing, his parents'estate. Having been brought up in the North by Quaker relatives, he just hates violence and accordingly refuses a duel. As this is the only way in the South to settle a dispute between gentlemen, Tom's father is so infuriated by his behavior that Tom has no other choice but leave. Away from Magnolia Landing, Tom learns bravery and returns seven years later as "the notorious Colonel Blake", the terror of the Lower Mississippi...
metadata.Writer: Ethel Doherty, Joseph L. Mankiewicz, Booth Tarkington
metadata.Actors: Charles 'Buddy' Rogers, Mary Brian, June Collyer
